opencollective.name: CryptPad
opencollective.description: #ZeroKnowledge; Realtime Collaboration; XWiki Labs;

goals.title: Maintenance
goals.description:
30 days of development time funded, just enough for:
- Maintenance & Bug Fixes
- Regular release schedule
- Handling pull requests

goals.title: Spreadsheet
goals.description:
60 days of developer time funded
- Maintenance & release cycle, PLUS
- [Realtime and Office Documents](https://blog.cryptpad.fr/2018/07/13/CryptPad-Roadmap/#Goal-1-Spreadsheets-amp-Office-Documents)
  - Realtime collaborative spreadsheets, office documents and presentations with OnlyOffice
  - ZeroKnowledge as always, the server will not have access to the content of your pads

goals.title: Comments & Messaging
goals.description:
90 days of developer time funded
- Maintenance & release cycle
- Spreadsheets and Office Documents
- [Comments in Rich Text pads](https://blog.cryptpad.fr/2018/07/13/CryptPad-Roadmap/#Goal-2-Comments-on-Rich-Text-Pads)
  - Comments go in the righthand margin
  - Comments can be replied to
  - Comments can be marked "resolved"
- [Contacts and messaging](https://blog.cryptpad.fr/2018/07/13/CryptPad-Roadmap/#Goal-3-Contacts-and-Messaging)
  - Notifications when a pad is commented on
  - Notifications when a comment is replied to
  - At-reference a person to notify them
  - Chat box in each pad

goals.title: Shared Drive
goals.description:
110 days of developer time funded
- Maintenance & release cycle
- Spreadsheets and Office Documents
- Comments in Rich Text pads
- Contacts and Messaging
- [Shared Drive](https://blog.cryptpad.fr/2018/07/13/CryptPad-Roadmap/#Goal-4-Shared-Drive)
  - You will be able to create a shared drive, just like you create a pad
  - In your drive, you will be able to explore inside of the shared drive and organize it just like a folder
  - You will be able to share the link to the Shared Drive with other people, when they click the link, it will import the shared drive into their personal drive

goals.title: Federation
goals.description:
140 days of developer time funded
- Maintenance & release cycle
- Spreadsheets and Office Documents
- Comments in Rich Text pads
- Contacts and Messaging
- Shared Drive
- [Federated Messaging](https://blog.cryptpad.fr/2018/07/13/CryptPad-Roadmap/#Goal-5-Federated-Messaging)
  - You'll be able to import a pad or shared folder from another instance to your own
  - Clicking a link to become a contact will work, even if you are registered on a different instance
  - Once you have made a contact, all features in Contacts and Messaging will function across instances

goals.title: Permissions
goals.description:
180 days of developer time funded
- Maintenance & release cycle
- Spreadsheets and Office Documents
- Comments in Rich Text pads
- Contacts and Messaging
- Shared Drive
- Federated Messaging
- [Better Permissions](https://blog.cryptpad.fr/2018/07/13/CryptPad-Roadmap/#Goal-6-Better-permissions)
  - Ability to invite users and groups to a pad, and later revoke their access
  - Ability to revoke a link if it leaks out onto the internet
  - Private pads which are only accessible to particular people or groups

goals.title: Author Colors
goals.description:
200 days of developer time funded
- Maintenance & release cycle
- Spreadsheets and Office Documents
- Comments in Rich Text pads
- Contacts and Messaging
- Shared Drive
- Federated Messaging
- Better Permissions
- [Color-by-author](https://blog.cryptpad.fr/2018/07/13/CryptPad-Roadmap/#Goal-7-Color-by-author)
  - When an option is selected, text in the rich text app will be shaded with a color based on the author of that text
  - The user list will show users who have joined and then left again, along with the color of their changes
  - Right-clicking on the text will show the name of the person who wrote it (including whether they are one of your contacts)

240 days of developer time funded
- Maintenance & release cycle
- Spreadsheets and Office Documents
- Comments in Rich Text pads
- Contacts and Messaging
- Shared Drive
- Federated Messaging
- Better Permissions
- Color-by-author
- [Offline & Suggested Edits](https://blog.cryptpad.fr/2018/07/13/CryptPad-Roadmap/#Goal-8-Offline-and-Suggested-Edits)
  - Suggestion mode, your change is shown shaded and can be accepted or rejected, it will be attached to a comment so you can explain it
  - When offline, you are automatically put into suggestion mode instead of read-only mode
goals.title: Offline & Suggested Edits

opencollective.name: nock
opencollective.description: HTTP mocking and expectations library for Node.js

goals.title: Project revitalization
goals.description:
nock was published by [Pedro Teixeira](https://twitter.com/pgte) in 2011 and maintained it very actively until early 2016. It became the defacto mocking library for http requests in Node.js. Since Pedro moved on to other projects, nock lost its velocity, the current code base does not reflect the huge development in the Node community in the past years. A bigger effort will be necessary to 

1. modernize the code base
2. lower the barriers for new contributors
3. overhaul the documentation

Once we hit this initial balance goal, we will hire maintainer.io for an initial assessment of the project which will give us actionable times to improve the overall setup of the community. We will not use the money to pay contributors, but instead invest into the facilitation of contributions in general.

Once we fill good about the overall setup we will organize a global event to kickstart contributions to the project. For such an event to be successful we need a clear roadmap with many actionable tasks that individuals and teams can collaborate one. Help us to make it happen :)

A vital Open Source community depends someone accountable to create and grow a safe and inviting space where both volunteering and sponsored contributors enjoy to participate. This is exactly what http://maintainer.io provides, Open Source community facilitation as a service. 

With the help of maintainer.io we will be able to attract and retain more contributors with more diverse talents, be more transparent about our processes, automate more chore work and grow our maintainers team.

If you rely on nock then help us to make nock a poster child Open Source project and community <3
goals.title: Accountable Community Management

goals.title: 2 days p/w
goals.description:
This yearly budget goal would allow at least one person to work 2 full dedicated days a week on this library. 

Currently this library is maintained in our free personal time and we'd like to have the capacity/finances to afford someone to work on this full time - in this instance starting at 2 whole days a week.

This would help towards allowing us to deal with issues quicker, support the community more via discord, documentation, examples etc and keep up with feature releases.

This yearly budget goal would allow at least one person to work 3 full dedicated days a week on this library. 

Currently this library is maintained in our free personal time and we'd like to have the capacity/finances to afford someone to work on this full time - in this instance 3 whole days a week.

This would help towards allowing us to deal with issues quicker, support the community more via discord, documentation, examples etc and keep up with feature releases.

goals.title: Payout for contributors on github with $50/hour
goals.description: This yearly budget is needed to pay the current amount of github contributions with a rate of $50/hour. Contributors will start receiving payouts when crossing the threshold of $300. This goal assumes that the contribution amount doesn't increase.

goals.title: 50% Payout for contributors on github
goals.description: This yearly budget is needed to pay the current amount of github contributions with 50% of a rate of $50/hour. Contributors will start receiving payouts when crossing the threshold of $300. This goal assumes that the contribution amount doesn't increase.

goals.title: Buffer to grow contributors +50%
goals.description: This yearly budget is needed to pay the current amount of github contributions with a rate of $50/hour. Contributors will start receiving payouts when crossing the threshold of $300. This goal assumes that the contribution amount will grow by 50%.
